definition: to leave behind or give up completely
example: The project was abandoned due to lack of funding.

definition: existing in thought or as an idea but not having a physical or concrete existence
example: The concept of justice is abstract and can be interpreted differently.

definition: to provide with something needed; to make fit or suitable
example: The hotel can accommodate up to 200 guests.

definition: to gather or collect, often in gradual degrees
example: Snow began to accumulate on the mountain peaks.

definition: correct in all details; exact
example: The weather forecast was surprisingly accurate.

definition: to accept or admit the existence or truth of
example: He acknowledged his mistake and apologized.

definition: to gain possession of
example: She hopes to acquire new skills through this training program.

definition: to adjust or change to suit conditions
example: Animals must adapt to their environment to survive.

definition: sufficient for a specific requirement
example: The salary is adequate for covering basic living expenses.

definition: next to or adjoining something else
example: The library is adjacent to the main campus building.

definition: to publicly support or recommend
example: Many doctors advocate for regular exercise to prevent disease.

definition: a whole formed by combining several elements
example: The aggregate score of all tests determines the final grade.

definition: to distribute resources or duties for a particular purpose
example: The government will allocate more funds to education next year.

definition: open to more than one interpretation; not having one obvious meaning
example: The contract terms were ambiguous and caused confusion.

definition: to change or modify for the better
example: The constitution can be amended with proper procedures.

definition: a comparison between two things for the purpose of explanation
example: He used the analogy of a river to explain how electricity flows.

definition: occurring once every year
example: The company holds its annual meeting in December.

definition: to expect or predict
example: We anticipate a significant increase in sales this quarter.

definition: clearly visible or understood; obvious
example: It was apparent that she had been crying.

definition: to add something as an attachment or supplement
example: Please append your signature to the document.

definition: to recognize the full worth of
example: I appreciate all the help you've given me.

definition: based on random choice or personal whim
example: The decision seemed arbitrary and unfair to many employees.

definition: a particular part or feature of something
example: One important aspect of the job is teamwork.

definition: to gather together in one place for a common purpose
example: Students assembled in the auditorium for the graduation ceremony.

definition: to evaluate or estimate the nature, ability, or quality of
example: Teachers assess students' progress through regular tests.

definition: to allocate a job or duty
example: The manager will assign tasks to each team member.

definition: to suppose to be the case, without proof
example: I assume you've already finished your homework.

definition: to achieve or reach
example: She worked hard to attain her goal of becoming a doctor.

definition: a quality or feature regarded as a characteristic
example: Patience is an important attribute for a good teacher.

definition: the originator of any written work
example: The author spent three years writing her first novel.

definition: to make a process operate automatically
example: The factory decided to automate the production line.

definition: an advantage or profit gained from something
example: The main benefit of exercise is improved health.

definition: prejudice in favor of or against one thing, person, or group

definition: short in duration, extent, or length
example: Please give a brief summary of the main points.

definition: having the ability or qualities necessary for something

definition: to bring or come to an end
